related events so that Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- California Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
- Federal Emergency Action Plan - Title 29 CFR §1910.38

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM

is equipped with a high level float switch that is wired to shut down the compressors in the event of a high liquid level in the vessel. This prevents liquid ammonia from entering the compressors.

Main Liquid Feed Shut-Off Valve (King Valve)

Each high pressure receiver is equipped with a main liquid feed shut-off valve (king valve) that is clearly labeled and can be used to stop the flow of ammonia throughout the system.

Emergency Refrigeration Switch (E-Stop)

The principal entrance to the machinery room is equipped with an emergency refrigeration switch (e-stop) that controls power to the refrigeration machinery inside the machinery room. The switch can be activated in an emergency using the hammer next to the switch to break the switch glass.

1.2.6 Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart is treated as a single process.


1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 22,000

ow pressure accumulator.

Relief Valves
All ASME pressure vessels and positive displacement compressors are equipped with relief valves designed to relieve pressure and protect the equipment from rupturing. Details regarding the relief valves are summarized below:
Each relief valve has a set pressure equal to or less than the MAWP of the equipment that the relief valve protects;
Each relief valve has a capacity which meets or exceeds the requirement of ANSI/IIAR 2-2021 §15.3.8;
All relief valves are connected to a common manifold which terminates into the ammonia diffusion tank.

Diffusion Tank
The refrigeration system is equipped with an ammonia diffusion tank which mitigates most of the hazards associated with a relief valve lifting. The relief valve discharge piping is terminated at the bottom of the ammonia diffusion tank. The ammonia diffusion tank is 10' dia. x 25' high (14,687 gallon capacity). At a water level of 20'-0, the tank contains 11,750 gallons of water which exceeds the quantity recommended by ANSI/IIAR 2-2021 §15.5.3 which is based on 1 gallon of water per pound of ammonia released through the largest relief valve in the system in 60 minutes. Under normal conditions, the ammonia diffusion tank contains water.

Reciprocating Compressor Safety Devices
Each reciprocating compressor has numerous safety devices to protect the compressor and the associated equipment. The following list summarizes the safety devices built into each compressor package:
High Discharge Pressure Cutout - The high discharge pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the discharge pressure equals or exceeds the setpoint.
Low Suction Pressure Cutout - The low suction pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the suction pressure is equal to or less than the setpoint.
Oil Pressure Cutout - The oil pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the oil pressure equals or exceeds the setpoint.

High Level Float Switch

The main suction accumulator

of the evaporative condensers is to reject the heat absorbed in the evaporators and compressors to the atmosphere. The evaporative condensers receive high pressure, superheated vapor from the compressors and supply high pressure liquid to the high pressure receivers. The condensers use air and water to cool the warm ammonia as it passes through a series of tubes within the condensers. Water is contained in the sump of the condensers, which is then pumped and sprayed over the ammonia coil. As the cooling medium of air and water draws the heat from the vapor, the refrigerant condenses into a liquid and flows to the high pressure receivers. Under normal conditions, the evaporative condensers contain high pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

1.2.5 Safety Systems

Ammonia Detection System
The machinery room and each refrigerated room are equipped with an ammonia detector. The detection system is interlocked with the refrigeration system controls as follows:
If the ammonia concentration exceeds 25 ppm inside the refrigerated rooms, ammonia alarms will be initiated. In addition, the auto-dialer will notify facility personnel;
If the ammonia concentration exceeds 40 ppm inside the machinery room, audible/visual alarms outside the machinery room will be activated. In addition, the auto-dialer will notify facility personnel.

Emergency Control Box
The Emergency Control Box (ECB) is installed on the east wall of the machinery room and contains three (3) valves.
Valve #1: High Side Discharge Valve
Valve #2: Low Side Discharge Valve
Valve #3: High to Low Pressure Control Valve
If necessary, these valves can be used to achieve the following results:
Valve #1 is used to relieve the pressure of the high side of the system to the relief valve discharge termination point. 
Valve #2 is used to relieve the pressure of the low side of the system to the relief valve discharge termination point.
Valve #3 is used to equalize the pressure from a high pressure receiver to a l

suction accumulator receives vapor from the flooded accumulators and separates any residual liquid from the vapor to allow only the vapor to be piped to the suction of each compressor. Liquid in the main suction accumulator drains by gravity into the liquid transfer vessel. The main suction accumulator is equipped with a high level float switch that is wired to shut down the compressors in the event of a high level situation. This prevents liquid ammonia from entering the compressors. Under normal conditions, the main suction accumulator contains low pressure vapor ammonia.

Liquid Transfer Vessel
The purpose of the liquid transfer vessel is to transfer liquid from the low side of the refrigeration system back to the high pressure receivers. The liquid transfer vessel receives liquid from the main suction accumulator. Once the liquid level in the liquid transfer vessel reaches the float switch, the three way solenoid valve is energized for a period of time causing the liquid transfer vessel to become subject to high pressure and allowing the liquid to drain, by gravity, into the high pressure receivers. Under normal conditions the liquid transfer vessel can contain either high or low pressure liquid and vapor.

Compressors
The purpose of the compressors is to raise the temperature and pressure of the low pressure gas in order to reject the heat absorbed in the evaporator to the atmosphere. The compressors receive low pressure vapor from the main suction accumulator and discharge high pressure vapor to the evaporative condensers. Each compressor has an integral oil separator that receives the high pressure vapor and separates residual oil from the ammonia so that the oil can be returned to the compressor. The compressors are equipped with high discharge pressure cutouts to shut the equipment off if the pressure exceeds the setpoint. Under normal conditions, the compressors contain both high and low pressure vapor ammonia.

Evaporative Condensers
The purpose

e (king valve) that is clearly labeled and can be used to stop the flow of ammonia throughout the system. Under normal conditions, the high pressure receivers contain high pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Flooded Accumulators
The purpose of each flooded accumulator is to provide a supply of low pressure liquid ammonia to the evaporators. Each accumulator is equipped with an expansion valve which expands the high pressure liquid into a low temperature and pressure liquid as it enters the vessel. The flooded accumulators supply, by gravity, low pressure liquid to the associated evaporators. Liquid and vapor returned from the evaporators is separated inside the flooded accumulators to allow only the vapor to be returned to the main suction accumulator. Under normal conditions, the flooded accumulators contain low pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Air-Cooling Evaporators (Flooded)
The purpose of the air-cooling evaporators is to remove heat from the air in order to maintain a predetermined space temperature. The air-cooling evaporators receive liquid from a flooded accumulator. The evaporators contain a set of continuous coils through which the low pressure liquid flows. Due to the low pressures and temperatures maintained in the evaporator, the liquid refrigerant absorbs a great deal of heat from the surrounding area and evaporates. To increase the rate of heat removed, the evaporators use an electric fan to move warm air over the coils of cold liquid ammonia. Once the liquid has evaporated to form low temperature and pressure vapor, it returns to the supplying vessel. The liquid ammonia enters the bottom of the evaporator coil and as the liquid boils into a vapor, it rises through the coil and returns to the flood accumulator. Under normal conditions, the air-cooling evaporators contain low pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Main Suction Accumulator
The purpose of the main suction accumulator is to prevent liquid from entering the compressors. The main

1.2.4 Process Chemistry

The refrigeration system employed at Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart is configured for flooded operation. The function and thermodynamics of each major component type in the system is summarized below:

High Pressure Receivers
The purpose of the high pressure receivers is to provide a safe location to add and store high pressure liquid ammonia in the refrigeration system. The high pressure receivers receive high pressure liquid from the condensers and supply high pressure liquid to each zone of refrigeration. The high pressure receivers are also used to provide storage for ammonia not being used in the system at any given moment. The high pressure receivers are equipped with a main liquid feed shut-off valv

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart operates a commercial cold storage for table grapes in Earlimart, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(2) Precoolers
(8) Rooms

1.2.2 Facility Location

Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart is located at 315 N. Front St. Earlimart, CA 93219. The latitude and longitude of the largest high pressure receiver is 35.886490, -119.274518. The facility is located approximately 500 feet west of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

Flood Hazards
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.

Seismic Susceptibility
Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk:
Pond Fault - <150 Years
Poso Creek Fault - <1,600,000 Years
Unnamed Faults - <1,600,000 Years
The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Sunview Cold Storage Earlimart has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

Flooded System
The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sunview Cold Storage - Earlimart has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                | Process Chemical               | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration         Anhydrous Ammonia                22,000
 
Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:
